title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | SB 1.17.14-15 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 21-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya Chaksharun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and paying respects to spiritual teachers.

segments.key_quote: Whoever causes offenseless living beings to suffer must fear me.
segments.summary: HH Stoka Krishna Swami introduces the verses to be discussed (SB 1.17.14-15) and begins explaining the meaning of verse 14, focusing on the protection of the innocent and the consequences for those who cause suffering.

segments.key_quote: Dishonest miscreants flourish because of cowardly and impotent executive heads of state. This is the present situation.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Srila Prabhupada's purport, discussing the degraded state of leadership in Kali Yuga, where unqualified and sinful leaders fail to protect the innocent and curb miscreants.

segments.key_quote: When the miscreants are punished in an exemplary manner, automatically all good fortune follows.
segments.summary: The lecture emphasizes the importance of strong and qualified leadership that can effectively punish miscreants, deter others, and protect peaceful citizens, highlighting the prime duty of the executive head of state.

segments.key_quote: Sankirtana Yajna is the most recommended process for cleansing the hearts of the people in general.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the role of devotees as peaceful citizens and the importance of preaching Krishna Consciousness through Sankirtana to purify the hearts of the people and create a peaceful society.

segments.key_quote: In spite of this program, Sankirtana program, some demoniac natured persons will not mend themselves. They will have to be punished by the able administrator king.
segments.summary: The lecture explains how people become contaminated by bad association and the influence of Rajoguna and Tamoguna, leading to lust and greed, and reiterates the need for punishment for those who do not reform despite the Sankirtana program.

segments.key_quote: An upstart living being who commits offenses by torturing those who are offenseless shall be directly uprooted by me even though he be a denizen of heaven with armor and decorations.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains verse 15, focusing on the idea that even beings from higher planets are subject to justice if they commit offenses, and discusses the relative immortality of heavenly beings.

segments.key_quote: This means that the state executive head must be as strong as Maharaj Pariksit so that he may be determined to punish the strongest offenders.
segments.summary: The lecture emphasizes that even denizens of heaven are not exempt from punishment if they violate divine law, and the executive head of state must be strong and impartial in administering justice.

segments.key_quote: So this is the position that is being explained in the Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes the session, mentioning the upcoming discussion on Parikshit Maharaj's dealings with Kali Purusha.
